website_summaries.verdict: A great general WiFi extender from Linksys with a large enough range for most homes.
pros: WiFi extender plugs into any outlet, making it easy to extend the wireless range in virtually any part of the home
Leaves another outlet available for other electronics
cons: Connecting to some non-Linksys routers can be tricky, with random dropouts

customer_reviews.title: Brought my system to its knees
customer_reviews.text: I used this with the Linksys EA9300, which is a great router. I know very well how to use networks, routers, switches, etc. I set it up in range extender mode with duplicate network names for each band, and 802.11r roaming enabled. I used the linksys utility to determine the optimal extender location (quite close to the router). 1. Very little range increase. 2. Significant speed reduction. 3. The router w/ extender handed out duplicate addresses, and clients stopped working. I tried numerous changes to the setup over several weeks, and finally unplugged and tossed it aside.
customer_reviews.author: Duke of the Foothills

customer_reviews.title: Garbage product.
customer_reviews.text: This thing consistently disconnects, I followed manufacturer's setup guide in the instructions manual. I have the LINKSYS AC1900 router, always getting disconnected from this thing. Garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Terrible extender. Always losing connection with router and internet
customer_reviews.text: Keeps losing internet connection with router. Devices connected to it simply stop getting internet connection. Tried several thing to make it work better, but no luck. Trying to use 2.4Ghz only, bur connection is a nightmare. I have 120Mbps DLS and at 2.4Ghz, this extender drops me to 2Mbps, when it works. Most of the time lost connection to either router or internet. Still browsing for some tips at Linksys community, but can't believe a extender and router from the same manufacture does not work together. It should come with easy install bottom for same devices. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Thiago

customer_reviews.title: horrible. The worst i have gotten in my 93 years on this planet
customer_reviews.text: the first order was for an inexpensive extender and after hours on the phone, the tech said it is defective and to return it. Then I ordered an expensive one C7000 and in order to get warranty it must be re4gistered. The tech tried and tried the sedrial number to register the product and finally concluded that the serial number will not allow registration and so, no tech helop, no warranty, no service. Once again I returned it also. Thank goodness for Amazon. They refunded me on both items. all this waster many many hours of my time. HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.author: SWELLMEL

customer_reviews.title: Waste.
customer_reviews.text: Ultimately, this has caused more problems that it has solved. Totally unstable, duplicates my IP address and has to be "rebooted" every couple of days. Unfortunately, it's too late to return it, so I guess it's eWaste.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Del Sesto

customer_reviews.title: A must buy if you are work from home and have gigabit internet service
customer_reviews.text: I had this up and running within 2 minutes. Use the WPS button for a fast connection for both 2.4g and 5g. I specifically purchased this to allowed a wired connection to my work PC via Ethernet and the speed when tested was 200mbps! I was NOT expecting that!!! Have used this for over a week and still have consistent speeds. Very, very happy with this purchase. My router is a Linksys with MIMO capability.
customer_reviews.author: Black Sovereign

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me in my home
customer_reviews.text: I read that this would extend my Wi-Fi signal and cut down on some of the buffering I have a three level home the router was moved down to the second level the television was in the basement and it still did not increase the Wi-Fi signal or improve on the buffering even though I call tech-support three times and I tried this for 2 1/2 weeks I ended up sending it back for a refund
customer_reviews.author: T. Echols

customer_reviews.title: Duplicate IPAddresses
customer_reviews.text: Every time I try to use the extender, my pc alerts me that I have a duplicate IP address conflict on the network. Tech support is unable to help. I spent an hour with tech support and we reset everything. In the end, they configured it the same way that I had. I have tried to use a static IP address, within and outside of the DHCP range. Nothing seems to fix the duplicate IP address conflict. I think that the router is getting confused when a device connects, via the extender, that was previously connected directly to the router. The only way to fix the duplicate IP address problem is to unplug and not use the extender.
customer_reviews.author: EsinEs

customer_reviews.title: Broke after three months
customer_reviews.text: The main issue is that the device stopped working and won't even power on only three months after purchase. Even more shocking is that Linksys expects customers to pay to ship their defective products back to them. They gave me an exception as a courtesy, but in all honesty if they hadn't extended the "courtesy" they would have permanently lost me as a customer. When it was working I found performance to be good, but range didn't impress me much. Still, it's better than nothing when it works. Here's hoping the replacement lasts longer than three months!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Is this the year 2000?
customer_reviews.text: Clunky to setup. I've configured the 2.4 GHz band and devices are connected to it, yet the extendeder says it's not configured. You would think this Linksys would just make this plug n play with it's routers. It has its own network settings which is dumb. Also tech support is on India and as about as useful as a glass hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Saget

customer_reviews.title: Installation is NOT straightforward
customer_reviews.text: The instructions that came with the RE7000 were comprehensive, in that they covered several different set up configurations. Despite this, I was only able to get the extended to connect with the 2.5 G band, but not the 5G band. 2 hours on the phone with Linksys technical help line did not solve it. I called my ISP and paid for them to send a tech out to my house. 10 minutes for him to get it to work. Go figure..... I can’t say why it was so difficult, but glad it’s working now.
customer_reviews.author: C. W. S.

customer_reviews.title: One Restart after Another
customer_reviews.text: I got the range extender connected to my router online (not via the WPS button, which does not work, as others have pointed out) and positioned it ideally in my house according to the setup process, but for the next few days, it was just one restart of the router and/or range extender after another as the extended networks (2.4 GHz and 5 GHz) kept cutting out. Restart again, again, again...? Uh, no, we're done; returned. If you buy this, install it immediately, so that if it doesn't work for you, you're still inside the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Daywriter

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Like most wi-fi products, the majority of poor review you see are by people who don't have any grasp on technology whatsoever and expect everything to be dumbed-down for them via phone support. This device serves its purpose well for me; expands my wireless network upstairs and acts as an ethernet port for my work (voip) phone and docking station. I get 250 Mbps down at my router and 212 down connected wirelessly via this device on the opposite side of the house. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Between the cost of this extender and the 9500 router they recommend to attach with this device,I cannot get it to connect. Grrr
customer_reviews.text: CHANGED my review. This product does kick / you know what. Cannot get it to connect to my Linksys 9500 router . I’ve tried a zillion times. I will admit I am not tech savvy, I have followed the instructions to the letter-still - cannot get a connection. Probably my fault BUT with the cost of this extender/bridge and their most expensive router I purchased to go along with this item specifically -the installation should be much easier-and it is not!
customer_reviews.author: Dave York Pa

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I could be my WiFi signal on the other side of my house. It took a couple of tries to place it in the prime spot where the signal wasn't to close or to far from the router but once it was set, the signal strength that came out from it was impressive. Had to use my smart phone to set it up, which took a couple of tries so I kept going back to the instructions to verify what I was doing. So far it is holding up. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: cable215

customer_reviews.title: Not an easy set-up at all.. Even with a Linksys router.
customer_reviews.text: Boy was this a chore to get set-up. I finally got it working after being on a call with tech support for 2 hrs. YES! two-hours. I'm a fairly component person when it comes to setting these things up. Our Linksys router was a breeze, but this extender was a nightmare. It was practically impossible to get this to be recognized by my router. I was going to return it, but at the last min. Tech support was able to help by going in and pretty much setting up my network from scratch.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crane

customer_reviews.title: Absolute piece of crap...never got past setup
customer_reviews.text: I wish Amazon had a zero rating!! After reading several reviews...fives and ones...I should have known better. I even followed the directions for a manual setup ( to no avail. During my first attempt, saw the device on wifi...then nothing...no lights, no signal....nothing. Plugged the device into several outlets in my house....nothing...dead. Read the 1 and 2 reviews...intermittent response. Piece of crap...OOBF (Out of Box Failure). Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Russell

customer_reviews.title: No range on the 5ghz
customer_reviews.text: The setup is really easy, but to have any level of speed you need to be on the 5ghz network, and that doesn't work unless you are really close. I called customer service, and it said that the 5 ghz is only expected to work when you are within 5-10 feet of the extender. So, that's a pretty bad extender in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: SotaGrrl

customer_reviews.title: Linksys ac1900 works great but install was a bear
customer_reviews.text: It works very well and I have a very strong signal where I had almost none before. The installation was a real pain. I could not get the setup to work and had to contact support. After 2.5 hours we managed to get it working. I don't know if I just got a bad one or if all are this difficult but I can't imagine they are or it would have been recalled by now. Anyway it works great now.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great - if you can get a CAT 5 cable to it
customer_reviews.text: I put this in the garage to make it possible to stream music and look up things on the internet when working on cars. The only tricky thing is that you have to have a CAT 5 cable to it, so depending on where you're going to put it, pulling one could be completely prohibitive. I had no problem though and am enjoying rock-solid wifi in the garage and waaaaay out into the yard.
customer_reviews.author: SEOMike

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: For a moment I forgot why I have loved Linksys so much for the past 25 years. The company makes amazing IT products that are among the most powerful on the market and so so simple to install (and seem to last forever). Whether you are someone afraid to touch a machine or a super technologist, this is the best wifi extender on the market. I won't forget to buy Linksys for my networking products ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not retain it's configuration
customer_reviews.text: This product is actually made by Belkin. I have 2 of them and I hate them. For no apparent reason they will just reset themselves and I have to go through the entire process again. Most of the time you do not realize they are not working properly and your just left with terrible wifi coverage till you have to reset them again. I called support no less than 5 times about this and all they do is help you reset the device. No explanation why it reset on its own. DO NOT BUY THEM.
customer_reviews.author: LouisA

customer_reviews.title: Takes all the download speed to operate
customer_reviews.text: Used this booster for about 4 months. At first it worked great - our modem/router is in the basement and we got very limited wifi signal on our 2 level. With the booster we had decent download speeds throughout the whole house. Fast forward 4 months - internet is out in our whole house repeatedly. Provider comes out to try to fix it, runs tests and says one of our devices is using all the download speed available. Nothing works in the house, then we unplug the Linksys Booster and everything springs back to life. Too late to return, too late for tech support, this booster will be going in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kmw814

customer_reviews.title: Once I installed it my WiFi was unrelable
customer_reviews.text: There was not one day I couldn't go without my entire WiFi network dropping for a few minutes. Very annoying and not reliable. I used the WPS feature of my ISP modem WiFI to extend the range and it did do this, but the reliability was crap. Save yourself the hassle and invest in a true Mesh WiFi.... you will be more happy if you do.
customer_reviews.author: Dolfan Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi extender!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to your home wireless network. The unit is very simple to setup. The best part is that you have 1 wireless network not 2. No need to swap between to signals. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the king!
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through several extenders trying to find one that will simply do what it says and extend the range of my wifi signal as per the item claims...this one does! I get a nice 5G signal back in my room and higher speeds than other devices. and setup was so easy a kindergartener could do it...highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Z

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and has improved our wifi.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Just need to plug it in. Not so easy to set up, at least for me. There is an instruction manual but it was not as easy to following the instructions. I had to call tech support. Tech support was very helpful and walked me through the process. It has helped improved our wifi signal but it's not 100 % better.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya H

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and improved signal
customer_reviews.text: This product was very easy to setup. The instructions that came with the product were accurate and easy to understand. I had it setup with in a few minutes. I used it with a Linksys Max-Stream AC2200 MU-MIMO Tri-band Wireless Router, which may have simplified the setup. I wanted to boost the signal in my basement. The steaming device now gets 100% signal strength, which was an improvement over the previous 67%.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bremseth

customer_reviews.title: Works great once setup
customer_reviews.text: It wouldn't connect on my router with the wps switch so I rebooted the extender hit the reset button tried again with the same. I re-did the reboot and reset then I tried it "plan B" with the internet. Plan B worked and now I enjoy internet in my back yard. I'm very pleased with the extender now that it's working.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful extender
customer_reviews.text: After I got FIOS and put the modem/router at one end of my house, my old extenders weren't strong enough (my old router was in the middle of the house). This one goes through three walls to reach a room on the floor below. The installation process tells you if the spot you are trying to place the extender in is too close, too far, or just right. Worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Jukebox John

customer_reviews.title: worked well up until its anniversary; then KAPUT
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in June 2016. Unit started flaking out just after its anniversary - like clockwork. Unit started getting fairly hot. Then in the last week, it began signal dropping every 20 minutes or so. Unplug and rest/cool off (both me and the extender) and replug; it connects and maintains connection for another variable number of minutes - but on average about 20; then signal drops again. My assessment is it is dying. Since I think the warranty period is over, I am going to buy something else. After this performance I am wary (and weary) to buy a replacement from Linksys. Who has time for this kind of thing?
customer_reviews.author: KTUPPER

customer_reviews.title: Must be set up as new unit each time power goes off in the house
customer_reviews.text: Very annoying, this has good range and works fine after an initial setup, which is easy. But if power goes off in the house, which it does commonly in California, this does not recover any of its settings. I have to set it up as entirely new each time. I usually am super happy with LinkSys so super disappointed in this one.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set UP
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received was DOA. No indicator or ethernet lights Amazon immediately replaced and I returned it. New one setup couldn't have been easier. Using WPS for the dual channel network. Established two extensions. Used spot finder to fine tune location and manage (include changing default password extender password.
customer_reviews.author: Tomintx

customer_reviews.title: This product is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I've read a lot of reviews about this product and they are not good. It is very common for these devices to die after the initial one year warranty runs out. Mine lasted for 16 months. LinkSys would not help me out at all. It is not a cheap device either so this is the last LinkSys product that I will ever buy. It will not power up at all and there are no lights on it no matter which socket I plug it into. It is a brick...an expensive brick. Time to look at Netgear and others.
customer_reviews.author: Toot

customer_reviews.title: Really works grreat
customer_reviews.text: This unit is unbelievable, the ease to set up, with easy setup for an I ungeek like me. Basically a plug and play device. Signal strength covers my entire house at full signal, over 9000k sq ft. Best of all, it works on dual band. After my first unit, I bought 2 more as I have 3 houses. On my rental house it allows 3 tenants to share one WiFi account, by purchasing a top choice option from cable provider.
customer_reviews.author: barry

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Using a Linksys Max Stream AC2200 for and ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Using a Linksys Max Stream AC2200 for and this RE7000 as an access point. I'm at 70Mbps for 2/3 of my 2000 sq.ft. home and no worse than 30Mbps in the far corners. Router/Wifi Hub is in a terrible place - converted garage electrical closet. Easy set up and works great. If I wasn't so lazy I crawl under the house and relocated my home run Cat 5e to a different room along with my cable drop...but that would require being truly motivated to crawl in the dirt for 100'...
customer_reviews.author: justsayyes

customer_reviews.title: Sorta works, but really lame
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t extend your network so much as it broadcasts a second network, which makes it super annoying cause you have to manually change your devices back and forth between your WiFi networks as you walk around your house. Gee thanks for giving me a problem I never wanted. Also the range and signal strength suck.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Changed the throughput from the wireless router tremendously
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Went from 200 mb/s (where I'm paying for 460mb/s), all the way up to 460 now. I guess there was a deadspot in that bedroom. This completely fixed the issue. I hard wire an ethernet into the bottom of the device and it's basically runs just like I was hardwired into the actual router itself. In fact, I get the same speed on both computers. (one hard wired to actual router, one hardwired to extender)
customer_reviews.author: computer nerd

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of crap; steer clear
customer_reviews.text: After a total pain in the ass install where WPS button doesn't work, had to be manually plugged in, and the signal goes in and out; less than a year later; it's dead. Signal not working, again, so I decided to reset it. Pulled it out of the wall outlet and brought it to my computer to reset, plugged it in and no lights, no nothing. Not even a year old. No return after 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Mongo

customer_reviews.title: Not very well product
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't meet my expectations. I have a two floor house, and I bought the product in order to extend the wifi signal from the second to the first floor, but id doesn't work at all. It was easy to install and pair with the router, but at the end, I have the same signal strenght with the product connected or disconnected. I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Fernando Restrepo

customer_reviews.title: The best rage extender
customer_reviews.text: This device is the best option, cost benefits. Robust, 5G and with a Ethernet port. Easy to setup. The option to work like an access point with the ethernet Port is just perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Camilo Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Prett bad Experience
customer_reviews.text: Plugging in the unit near the router to obtain a connection went fine. No real issues there. Once I started moving it around the house, a totally different story. I'll start by saying, every place that i tried this thing in the house there was at least two bars of service from the router. Basement: this actually made the service worse ( I don't know how that's possible) My sons room: No improvement, as if we didn't have it. Garage: no improvement My other son's room, no improvement. I don't know what else to say, it either did nothing at all to boost the signal or it actually made it worse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I had thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: Installed in garage (downstairs from router) to enable my Nexx Garage app to work more efficiently... granted, the carriage home has steel stud construction within the walls, but it worked only for a short while, and then it wouldn't reconnect.... I would get indications that it was in the perfect location, and then it would just go offline... I would not recommend this installation for the type of construction we have... since replaced it with a TPLink AC6200 extender... and have NO problems.....
customer_reviews.author: jts11050

customer_reviews.title: Much needed extension for thick walled house
customer_reviews.text: It's hard for our house to use WiFi usually because we have thick walls and spots throughout out the house that "hinder" WiFi signal, especially outside. These work great for what I've needed and the WPS on the side works easily with new Linksys max streams phone app. I didn't need to set up anything but the new router, phone and WPS buttons auto-programmed extensions for easy set-up. Love it. Definitely would suggest for anyone looking to extend their network and prioritizing the Extenders is easy for maximum bandwidth on devices connected to them.
customer_reviews.author: Jaysin

customer_reviews.title: It only works if it wants to
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this extender and an Arlo Pro base station so that I can properly install my Arlo cameras outside the garage. The Arlo base station is plugged in to this Linksys Extender via ethernet cable. Needless to say, I can only view my cameras outside about 5% of the time. When my camera picks up a motion and and records a video, the recording stops abruptly. Most of the time my Arlo cameras would say they are offline. I have wasted my time with Linksys support and they had me do things that I have already done with my Linksys Router and this extender. I even lurked in the Linksys forums and tried all suggestions there to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: H. Mina

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and great speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible. Easiest setup ever. CenturyLink customer. Press a WPS button twice and this sweet Wifi extender is working. Mine is installed in a detached garage about 45 feet from the router. Brick house. Dramatic increase in upload/download speeds. I never had 5G in my garage until now. Can you say Roku stick? Best investment in a long time. Go for it quick.
customer_reviews.author: mark prusa

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect  but meets my needs
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my main router and bought these to work with two external Nest Cameras. The set up do not work easily and had to resort to manual configuration. Works OK but I have black out issues but this may be a Comcast issue where they upgrade their WIFI software. These are small and compact and are OK for intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Len in Florida

customer_reviews.title: A friend recommended getting a range extender
customer_reviews.text: We have a freakishly long house. Internet was nil in the bedroom area. A friend recommended getting a range extender. After years of century link crappiness, we now have a much better signal in all areas of our home. YAY for this little white magical box. And it was super easy to set up. You can tell by my technical review that I am a computer genius. It took only a few minutes and I had netflix on my smart tv. Again, MAGICAL!!
customer_reviews.author: michelle T

customer_reviews.title: Set up could be easier but it is great
customer_reviews.text: This works great and I love how it works with my router with the same network names and passwords so I don’t have to change networks when I go to the other side of my house. I held back one star because the WPS did not work. I had to do a manual connect. But now that it is connected it is working great. Much better than the previous range extender I had. I love that it extends both bands. Overall I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Don R.

customer_reviews.title: Underperformer.
customer_reviews.text: This appliance was decidedly an underperformer. I purchased to pair with my Linksys EA9500. I have ring doorbells that I wanted to boost their strength. No matter where in in my house I placed this $100 appliance. No improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Tippie Jacks

customer_reviews.title: WiFi signal is slow!
customer_reviews.text: It calls itself a “WiFi Booster” but we found it to be very slow and not really a booster. Lots of spinning and waiting on Loading.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: outstanding technical help
customer_reviews.text: When you are 70+ years, often the tech support person seems to be discussing your problem in a foreign language. NOT the case with Linksys Support. I am so pleased with your technician and the outstanding help received. One call, and all my concerns were resolved. I have been more than pleased with my router, and when I experienced one problem, I was helped immediately. thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, works great
customer_reviews.text: Finally have a good connection in my basement. Happy wife, happy life! Connected this to my Linksys AC5400 Tri Band Wireless Router (Max Stream EA9500). Setup was easy, placement was not so easy due to having to find a good location with receptacles near by. The on board firmware needed updating out of the box, which I did. The included spot finder really helped in finding a good place. The location I thought was best was certainly not the best.
customer_reviews.author: greg1174

customer_reviews.title: Could be better...
customer_reviews.text: I've got a few issues with this device: - It can only extend 1x2.4GHz and 1x5GHz network... I'm mostly interested in 2.4GHz to have maximum range, but can't extend my network and my guest network... Bit annoying. - Accessing the configuration web page was problematic at times, many attempts would take me straight to the linksys website instead which kept telling me I wasn't connecting through the extender, even though I was. Frustrating. - I bought it to work along my WRT1900AC linksys router but the integration was a bit disappointing, it seems for full integration, you need to have an even more expensive router: No thanks. I've now returned the extender and I'm exploring amplifi mesh network instead.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable as an extender
customer_reviews.text: First, you have to create a new SID, it will not work as a true extender. Also, even if you decide to accept the additional SID for the device, it will constantly go 'offline' and you'll have dropped internet connections and sometimes it will never connect at all. Waste of money and I will be replacing it even though I cannot get a refund since I've had it for too long.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C.

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service ... Excellant
customer_reviews.text: My chat person was so super kind and patient. I had a problem with a disconnect of my extender and we were chatting for almost an hour until I got my extender to reset and work. But he was there every step of the way. This is why I love Linksys products.
customer_reviews.author: loveparfum57

customer_reviews.title: Good device
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid device and I would recommend to anyone who is looking for a range extender for their home. The only issue that I have with it is that if it looses connection (you restart you router) with the primary router, it doesn't self recover. You'll need to reconnect it via the WPS button.
customer_reviews.author: cantusmellthat

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: After reading how difficult this product is to set up I was nervous to get started but got it all done and working in less than 10 minutes. It has really boosted the signal in an upstairs room . I would definitely recommend this product particularly if you have a Linksys router with which it works seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: tth

customer_reviews.title: Decent performance for a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product to aid with wi-fi addicted children that were complaining of lagging performance. We have a two story, four bedroom home. We were challenged initially with the set up but once we read that it didn’t really work well with WEP security, we changed our router settings to WPA2 and then setup was smooth sailing. My rocku stick instantly performed much better.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey L Kilroy

customer_reviews.title: Well made product that works well right out of the box.  Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: This extender really comes through with marginal signals. I had to bridge 150' through two walls and this did the job so much better then the other guys. I'm very please and have used Linksys products for years with trouble free service. This is a typical Linksys product from that standpoint. Plug it in and it works right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J.

customer_reviews.title: Linksys AC1900 Gigabit Range Extender
customer_reviews.text: It did not work for me to setup the AC1900 extender using the "Simple setup with Push Button Connect". I had to manually login and set it up. Once logged in to the extender, the setup was simple and fast. However, if you don't want the wifi to drop connection every time, my recommendation that you use the same SSID as your router during the manual setup process. Also, the extender range finder is a little flaky since it fluctuates too much.
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly101

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonders!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works wonders! The downstairs corner of our house was a serious dead spot for wifi, and even the 2.4g connection wouldn't reach. We decided to get this wifi extender so that the whole house would be completely accessible to internet. The setup was very fast and easy, and we now have up to 20 mb/s download speed in the very far corner of our house where we had no signal before. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking for better internet connection!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Gaggiano

customer_reviews.title: Poor range and different SSID
customer_reviews.text: Linksys claims a seamless continuation of your current SSID, that is not correct. In order to use this extender you have to set up a new SSID. There for every time you walk to the section of the house that has the extender you have to change the SSID in your phone your laptop or whatever device it may be. This is very inconvenient to the point of being useless. The range given in the information is also incorrect the farthest I was able to get this from a router was barely twenty feet.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: Well so far I’m not very pleased. We purchased this to extend the WiFi from the main house on our property to the right t house we are building but had a horrible time getting it set up and now it says it’s connected but anything we connect to it for wife , phones, fire stick, laptop, nothing works, says no connection. So it’s as if it really doesn’t work. I am not sure the problem and it’s extremely frustrating. If I can ever get things to work, I’d be happy to update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returning after just 2 days.
customer_reviews.text: I have already started the return process for this with only having it 2 days. Setup isn’t hard, but it keeps going out... as in it shows it’s connected to my main signals and is in a ideal area but will just stop allowing internet access. It tries but dosnt actually transmit anything. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J.wal-KCCO

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it is good enough
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to strengthen the wifi reach ability, however I keep on seeing the light switching from green to red. Maybe it is the main router which has the problem, so can't say if it was good enough at this moment.
customer_reviews.author: IcarusLives

customer_reviews.title: Slows internet speed to a crawl
customer_reviews.text: Liked its extremely easy setup, however, it slows internet speed consideIrably. I get 90 Mbps download speed when running tests on regular wifi. On ext wifi network (which I placed in the same room as the router for testing), I repeatedly only get 21 to 22 Mbps. I'm returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Maritza Ocasio

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE ~ money saver!
customer_reviews.text: I have a family of 6. In the past 6 months or so when using our electronic devices in our house, our Wi-Fi would suddenly drop. Then unbeknownst to us, we were using our phone data without even knowing it ~ the extra charges on our phone bill was getting out of control! I have had this extender for 2 weeks and I have NOT had one dropped Wi-Fi occurrence! I would definitely recommend this product. It was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: 4 1/2 stars only because of price
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation. I have the Linksys EA8300 so getting them paired up was quick. I didn’t give it 5 stars mainly because of the price; I got this on sale on Amazon but the list price I feel is too high for what it does. That being said, it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: There are issues with not just connecting but even when ...
customer_reviews.text: There are issues with not just connecting but even when it shows connected it doesn't function as it should. Seems to function on some devices but not all. So I believe there is a fix or setting adjustment(just don't know what to do. Always believed in Linksys but very difficult to get in contact and correct the issue.
customer_reviews.author: richard m.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well with minimal effort. Install was smooth, though I have done this before. The instructions were easily understood and setup took less than 15 minutes. I have to reboot it occasionally by unplugging and repluging it. Reboot completes in 2-3 minutes. I highly recommended this product.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Tingle, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Affective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this booster to get internet in our shop behind the house for exercise equipment. The signal light is orange, showing it isn't in an ideal location, but the WIFI works just fine. Super easy to set up, too.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Salas

customer_reviews.title: Not as powerful as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up but doesn't have very good coverage unless you have line of sight and that seems limited as well. Doesn't have the range it's advertised to have. I'm using it with a Linksys ROUTER EA4500. Should have good coverage but it's less than what I had before with an outdated Netgear extender.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Died after 1 yr. and 2 mos.
customer_reviews.text: Strength of signal was always borderline, ogt worse over time and when on the phone with support, it completely died. Lasted only 2 mos. past 1 year. Poor value for money.
customer_reviews.author: NOYB

customer_reviews.title: Bait an Switch ... bought as new sent refurbished
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on sale as new.... received a refurbished one. 2.4 g works 5g will not connect. Over 2 hours on with Linksys tech support an they advise to send it back
customer_reviews.author: abrooks4u

customer_reviews.title: It works reasonably well
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2800 sq ft house. Cisco router at one of the house in the basement office. Daughter’s bedroom at the opposite end second floor. We got this model because she streams on Roku and we didn’t want to risk a cheaper model. It works. Setup wasn’t a big deal...10 minutes. It doesn’t add a ton of range but enough.
customer_reviews.author: Erich

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be their best model But it will not pick up perception where my iPhone does. I don’t know why they don’t make a product that can pick up reception granted there’s two bedrooms but this is not picking up the perception that is 30 feet away from the Wi-Fi router, total of four walls
customer_reviews.author: Rafay K

customer_reviews.title: Since owning, my lost internet connection blues are gone.
customer_reviews.text: I have full bars vice two bars upon connection at the opposite end of the house. So far, I am happy. Have not dealt with tech support, device working well. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: It just stopped working making funny noises so instead of trying to figure it out ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an upgrade from the re4000w extender i had before. It just stopped working making funny noises so instead of trying to figure it out i just decided to buy a newer one and it was a success. Easy set up even if you can't do it with WPS access . You could also activate it using browser setup which is very easy to use. It even let's you know on the screen if you have the extender too close, just right or too far with a range of 10000 square feet . I'll be able to get connection in the yard as well. Great job lynksys!
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work
customer_reviews.text: Can’t get this to work. It shows a link to a Wi-Fi, but nothing will load. We have tried everything – even looked at many YouTube videos. It seems we are doing everything right, but it just won’t work.
customer_reviews.author: julia kittell

customer_reviews.title: Buyer must read
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this system for 2 story house, installation was not user friendly considering I am an electrician with networking ability. The extender would not work over 30ft and fault out. Tech support helped until the Linksys router I was using was discovered to be 3yrs old, EA6900 with AC1900. Same technology as the RE7000. They then want to charge a support fee for continued help. WPS also does not work even with similar devices. I was huge Linksys fan until I found this device to be such poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: can be a bear to get this set up, but when it is, it's great
customer_reviews.text: it's great once you get the device to "shake hands" with your WiFi router, but I threw 2.5 hours at it before calling tech support and spending another 60+ minutes with the technician remote-accessing my home network through my laptop and even HE had trouble. The happy ending is that the device is working as well as I hoped it might.
customer_reviews.author: Teri from NY

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, but limited speed.  Slower than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install, but I don't get full speed with it. When connected directly to my router, my download speeds are between 400 and 600Mbps, but with the extender, I only get about 100...
customer_reviews.author: Christian Huls

customer_reviews.title: It simply did not live up to the expectations...
customer_reviews.text: It simply did not help to improved my signal in a 2 story house. I honestly was expecting more from a product with so high reviews. The connection speed was the same with or without the extender. Long time buffering while streaming a 4K movie. My Internet speed is 300mbps. The setup was easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: UFSE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, I love it, works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome not like the Netgear that requires your SSID and password to be entered on their website. They don’t need to know this information. Thank you Linksys for making a excellent product, I finally can use my devices at a WiFi dead spot in my house I am completely happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: A Keeper
customer_reviews.text: Followed the simple installation instructions and I was in business. It has a range extender monitor that shows you how to get the most extension out of the unit and if the power goes out it reboots itself and goes right on extending your primary WIFI signal. Best extender I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: H Adams

customer_reviews.title: Reaches to a backyard studio with no problem.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a renovated music studio in the backyard of a house and this WiFi extender makes it possible for me to get WiFi. I followed the steps from someone in the comments section and it was pretty simple to install.
customer_reviews.author: jenna nelson

customer_reviews.title: not that good
customer_reviews.text: i purchaced this after reading reviews.it was relativaly easy to set up but it just has no range.it does not work well with my fios internet.i would not reccomend this unit
customer_reviews.author: robert ghantt

customer_reviews.title: I get better range with this thing unplugged
customer_reviews.text: I noticed problems with my Wifi, and I was surprised that the range was not great. When I unplugged the extender my reception improved
customer_reviews.author: N.J

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: A friend suggested to use this and we bought it based on his recommendation. We have been using this for couple of months and we love it. Internet speed has gone up and we are happy about it.I don't need to come back to living room where my router is.
customer_reviews.author: Lasata

customer_reviews.title: Good overall Extender
customer_reviews.text: Good overall extender. My router is on the second floor and this one is installed on my first floor. It does a good job. Easy to install and instructions are easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Signal
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out the right place to plug in the device and got the settings right, it has worked without flaw. I have an outdoor weather station that was daily loosing its signal and since setting up the Range Extender I have not lost signal once.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: My Linksys 6700 died and this one replaced it. Great product and customer support is tops! This is now many months later, and my AC 1900 Gigabit Extender is working great everyday. I am tremendously happy with its quality and consistent performance. It allows us to have wifi TV extended into my wife's therapy room and completes our whole house internet system. What a great product with equally great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: RJJ6

customer_reviews.title: All the wifi coverage you want.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent extender! The initial setup will probably be a little challenging for those not tech savvy but once it's setup, it works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: D.D.Top Contributor: Fragrance

customer_reviews.title: does a good job of getting wifi in the garage and on ...
customer_reviews.text: does a good job of getting wifi in the garage and on the deck. and i had no problem hooking it up. just read one of the other reviews and did what they did took all of 15 min.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wiedeman

customer_reviews.title: perfect - works great - easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: it took less than 10 minutes for me to setup and use awesome product, just plug it into any electric outlet and then go to your route and his the wps button! very easy!
customer_reviews.author: S. Brander

customer_reviews.title: Easy install but the range is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Easy install but the range is disappointing. Still get intermittent reception when sitting on my deck, only 25-30 feet from unit. Expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Extended my router range all the way out to about 400 feet from the house. I live on a farm so I wanted something that would get out to at least the barn and this extender did just that.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Algee

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t help at all
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. It has made no difference at all in WIFI connectivity for my devices. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Lai-Dee

customer_reviews.title: Big difference-glad I purchase them.
customer_reviews.text: Wow has made a big difference in my Wi Fi speech and connection strength. My Ring works so much better, I brought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Linksys RE7000 AC1900 Gigabit Range Extender / WiFi Booster / Repeater MU-MIMO (Max Stream RE7000)
product_meta.description: Boost Wi Fi coverage in and around your home with Max Stream AC1900+ Wi Fi Range Extender. Featuring Next Gen AC MU MIMO technology. It works with all Wi Fi routers including those with MU MIMO. With next generation MU MIMO technology, every connected device will get faster connections from any room in the house. Everyone in your home can simultaneously stream, game, surf, and more in an upstairs room or the patio with buffering. With Push Button Connect and Spot Finder Technology, setup is quick and easy.
feature_bullets: Eliminates Wi Fi dead zones and boost Next Gen AC Wi Fi in and around your home
Works with all Wi Fi Routers and Multi User MIMO Routers;Wireless MAC Filtering
Simple setup with Push Button Connect and Spot Finder Technology for optimal placement and performance
Advanced dual band Wi Fi Speeds up to AC1900 plus (N300 plus AC1733)
DIMENSIONS: 68 inches L x 24 inches W x 6 millimeter Thick
Cross Band and Beamforming Technologies work to optimize Wi Fi connections
Gain enhanced wired speeds for a Smart TV, gaming console, Blu ray Disc player or other Wi Fi device using the Gigabit Ethernet port
Can also work in Access Point mode for an expanded Wi Fi network, Wi Fi Bands : Simultaneous Dual band, 2.4 Ghz + 5 Ghz
NOTE: Please refer to the user manual before use and for trouble shooting steps

specifications.Wireless Type: 5 GHz Radio Frequency, 2.4 GHz Radio Frequency
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,238 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
